world.physics

Class Mechanics

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.physics.Mechanics

  • public class Mechanics
extends java.lang.Object
    A class dictating every used law in Newtonian physics.

      • Newtons_firstLaw_CalculateAcceleration

        public static Acceleration Newtons_firstLaw_CalculateAcceleration(Mass m1,
                                                  Mass m2,
                                                  Acceleration a1)
                                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        m1 - The first mass.
        m2 - The second mass.
        a1 - The first acceleration.
        Returns:
        The second acceleration, as calculated from the arguments. | return new Acceleration((a1.getScaledBy(m1.get() / m2.get()))
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the arguments is null. | m1 == null || m2 == null || a1 == null

      • Newtons_secondLaw_CalculateAcceleration

        public static Acceleration Newtons_secondLaw_CalculateAcceleration(Force f,
                                                   Mass m)
                                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        f - The given force.
        m - The given mass.
        Returns:
        The acceleration corresponding to this force and mass. | return (f.getScaledBy(m.get()))
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the arguments is null. | f == null || m == null

      • Newtons_thirdLaw_CalculateForce

        public static Force Newtons_thirdLaw_CalculateForce(Force f1)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        f1 - The given force.
        Returns:
        The opposite force. | return f1.getScaledBy(-1.0)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given force is null. | f1 == null

      • conservationOfMomentum_CalculateVelocity

        public static Velocity conservationOfMomentum_CalculateVelocity(Velocity v1,
                                                Mass m1,
                                                Mass m2)
                                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the velocity as dictated by the conservation of momentum, given the velocity and mass of the first object, and the mass of the second object.
        Parameters:
        v1 - The given velocity of the first object.
        m1 - The given mass of the first object.
        m2 - The given mass of the second object.
        Returns:
        A velocity equal and oposite to the velocity of the first object, scaled according to the masses of the objects. | result == new Velocity(v1.getScaledBy(m1.get() / m2.get()));
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the arguments is null. | (v1 == null || m1 == null || m2 == null)
